title: How to Grill Donuts

steps.headline: Buy glazed donuts.
steps.description: Grilling donuts doesn't mean you have to make them from scratch. In fact, store-bought donuts are more likely to deliver the grilled dessert you're craving. Go for traditional glazed donuts. You can even use day-old donuts if you have them sitting around your kitchen.

steps.headline: You can also make your own donuts.
steps.description: Grilled donuts are easier and tastier if you make them with store-bought glazed donuts. You can, however, make your own donuts to grill. Making your own donuts will take between 2 and 3 hours. You will make dough, let it rise, cut donuts, fry donuts, and, finally, glaze the donuts.

steps.headline: Cut each donut in half.
steps.description: Once you have bought or made your own donuts, cut them in half. With a serrated knife, slice each donut vertically. You should end up with two donut halves that resemble the halves of a hamburger bun.

steps.headline: Preheat your grill.
steps.description: Turn your gas grill on. In order to grill your donuts to perfection, you will need to make sure the grill is at the correct temperature. Turn your grill on to medium-high heat and make sure that it has reached the proper temperature before grilling your donuts.

steps.headline: Spray the grill with nonstick cooking spray.
steps.description: The last thing you want is for your delectable grilled donuts to stick to your grill! To make sure that you can easily remove your donuts after grilling, spray the grill surface with nonstick cooking spray. Olive oil or canola nonstick cooking spray work best.

steps.headline: Grill the donuts.
steps.description: Using metal thongs, place the donuts on the hot grill. Grill the donuts for 20-30 seconds, flip the donuts, and grill for another 20-30 seconds. Remove the donuts from the grill with metal tongs and place on a platter.

steps.headline: Make a grilled donut sundae.
steps.description: You can easily turn your grilled donut into an ice cream treat! Top each donut with one scoop of vanilla ice cream. Then drizzle chocolate syrup on top of the ice cream. Finish off your grilled donut sundae with 2 tablespoons of whipped cream and a smattering of sprinkles.

steps.headline: Turn your grilled donut into strawberry shortcake.
steps.description: Grilled donuts make a great base for strawberry shortcake. Slice 2-3 fresh strawberries for each donut you wish to turn into strawberry shortcake. Once you've grilled your donuts, top each one with 2-3 sliced fresh strawberries. Add several dollops of whipped cream on top of the strawberries and enjoy!

steps.headline: Try topping your grilled donuts with cinnamon and sugar.
steps.description: Mix ¼ cup granulated sugar with 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon. As soon as you remove your donuts from the grill, immediately toss them in the cinnamon and sugar mixture. Enjoy right away!

steps.headline: Top your grilled donut with jelly or jam.
steps.description: An easy way to turn your grilled donuts into a fruity dessert is to add your favorite jelly or jam. After you've grilled your donuts, try spreading 2-3 tablespoons of blackberry or blueberry jam on each donut. You can also use orange marmalade or cherry preserves for a tart treat!
